alert.note: Alert for Logan (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mingo and southwestern Logan Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 445 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hinch, or 15 miles south of Logan, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Man, Hinch, Gilbert Creek, Mallory, Chauncey, Hampden, Sarah Ann and Pie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
